nodes.desc: The Reasearch and Prototype team has been monitoring the current trends in smartphones/mobile technology. This illustration is meant to highlight the key components of their research.
As part of our tech watch we've highlighted all the top mobile trends of 2019
All custom-built code compiled natively and runs directly atop the mobile operating system.
Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS, tvOS and beyond.
Write better Android apps faster with Kotlin. Kotlin is a modern statically typed programming language. Kotlin is production-ready for your Android app development.
Use Java and Android Studio to write Android apps. You write Android apps in Java using an IDE called Android Studio
C# is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm programming language
All custom-built code executes inside the mobile platform’s native WebView control.
Apache Cordova is an open-source mobile development framework. It allows you to use standard web technologies - HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript for cross-platform development.

Flutter is an open-source mobile application development framework created by Google. It is used to develop applications for Android and iOS, as well as being the primary method of creating applications for Google Fuchsia.
React can be used as a base in the development of single-page or mobile applications, as it is optimal for fetching rapidly changing data that needs to be recorded.
Ionic Framework is the free, open source mobile UI toolkit for developing high-quality cross-platform apps for native iOS, Android, and the web—all from a single codebase.
According to Google Trends these are the top application development frameworks or languages (04-07-2019)

Personal or corporate data stored on phones can be at an increase security risk. Mobile security research has shown that some applications can store data that is not located in RAM nor a network that data essential sits inside the phone memory for easy access.

Biometrics is a technology that uses the unique patterns of physical or behavioral traits of users for authentication or identification. With biometric scanners on smartphones and other devices becoming more prevalent, as well as a growing number of services calling for high security and good customer experience, traditional methods of authentication (e.g., passwords and PINs) are increasingly being replaced by biometric technology

Compared with other biometric traits (e.g., face, iris, and voice), fingerprint-based recognition systems are studied most extensively and deployed most widely.For a fingerprint, the pattern of valleys and ridges is determined after birth, and different fingerprint patterns are owned by even identical twins.
Biometric solutions based on whole face geometry are already widely used. The increasing resolution of cameras on mobile devices makes them ideal as face biometric sensors.
To ensure a good quality voice sample, the individual usually recites some sort of text, which can either be a verbal phrase or a series of numbers.

In-app advertising allows mobile application developers to generate revenue despite publishing their work for free. As in traditional web-based advertising, personalization improves the effectiveness of in-app advertising (and thus increases the revenue earned by app developers).
A digital footprint is a trail of data you create while using the Internet. It includes the websites you visit, emails you send, and information you submit to online services.
Location based services can be defined as computer applications (especially mobile computing applications) that deliver information tailored to the location and context of the device and the user.

Multi-factor authentication strengthens login security by requiring a second piece of information — a second factor beyond your password. The second piece of information is usually a temporary code delivered by a device in your possession, such as your phone. It may also be something on your body, such as a fingerprint.

When setting up 2FA, most services allow you to use regular old text messages. When logging in, you will receive a short confirmation code on your mobile device. When prompted during login, enter your code.

Some services allow you to receive your temporary login code from a mobile app. Authenticator apps are also great because they work when you don’t have access to your phone network (e.g., when traveling internationally).

Security keys are one of the most secure and efficient ways to use 2FA. A security key is a physical USB device you can use to authenticate into your account. When prompted to provide your 2FA credentials, instead of typing in a code, you simply insert your security key and physically tap it when prompted during login.

Data collected by third parties through smartphone apps can include anything from profile information such as age and gender to location details, including data about nearby cell phone towers or Wi-Fi routers, and information about every other app on a phone.
All mobile platforms allow for the management of security configuration such as access control, encryption and remote wipe, thus providing adequate protection for many enterprise use cases.

The segregation of personal and corporate data is available through EMM/MDM, Android Enterprise, Chrome OS, Samsung Knox platform and Microsoft Windows Information Protection on Windows 10 Enterprise or Pro versions. This provides an alternative to containers. The concept is to create a way to isolate, manage and even encrypt corporate data away from the personal data.

Sensitive or regulated information may exist in many forms, such as email bodies, attachments, calendar appointments, credentials, keys, documents, spreadsheets, pictures and videos. Mobile devices may also have access to critical business apps that need to be protected from unauthorized access and use. Therefore, protection objectives apply to mobile devices the same as they do to any other enterprise computing system.

Security-minded companies have built enterprise authentication methods like certificates to increase security and management of mobile devices. Companies like Microsoft, Samsung and Google are building advanced authentication features like virtual and physical smart cards and multiple modes of biometrics.
Artificial Intelligence, or AI, is the ability of a computer to act like a human being. It has several applications, including software simulations and robotics.
Machine Learning, at its most basic form, is the practice of using algorithms to parse data, learn from it, and then make a determination or prediction about something in the world.
Qualcomm and others are developing AI that functions locally on the devices.
AI's development has grown alongside smartphone's modern appeal. Currently the trend is to provide AI services to mobile from the cloud.

Smartphones/mobile devices have become the top digital device by consensus over taking the desktop. Thus, M-commerce, is a natural evolution of e-commerce. Many companies have shifted their approach to attract their consumers through these devices.
Key features of M-commerce that is shaping retail and finance industries. As of 2017, this represents 34.5% of e-commerce sales (US). With the potential to grow to 54% by 2021.

IoT, allows several type of devices to function and be automated once connected to the internet. Smartphones are seen as the bridge that allows this connection. Namely, smart homes, transportation, health care and supply chain management.
Smartphones can be used in an IoT setup along with four application.
Mobile design trends are impacted by the current crop of smartphones. Currently the top selling phones are button-less with larger screens so design principals most adhere to that market.
User-oriented approach relies on in App gestures, pleasant aesthetics and simple navigation.

A Focus on user experience is critical in app design. App developers must empower user manipulation (e.g. gestures, rotate screen), enable user control of the App settings, and make sure app functions are consistent.
The accssibility standard for applications rem ain equally important. The app's text font and colours need to be legitible to all potential users of the app.
Where we find an increasing number of applications targeting health and fitness, and helping to solve everyday problems for users.
Where smartphones can be used in the context of connected cars to check the system status, or in smart homes.
Where crowd-sourcing applications could be used by citizens to contribute to a smart city.
Where smartphones are used for business to consumer (B2C) purposes such as sending customized services and vouchers in real time.
